bBWWAx-s2.memHandModelNotes: Absent above 750m (Hamel 1992) but Gill et al. (2001) states at higher elevation to 983 m when in sympatric range with golden-winged (i.e. GA & NC).  Nests in forest-field ecotone where most nests are 30m outside forest edge and rarely to 20m inside forests (Gill et al. 2001).  ****Hand Modeling: Do not restrict disturbed successional or shrub/scrub MU's to ecotone buffer. Amy Silvano 6jun05

bBWWAx-s6.memHandModelNotes: Absent above 750m (Hamel 1992) but Gill et al. (2001) states at higher elevation to 983 m when in sympatric range with golden-winged (i.e. GA & NC).  Nests in forest-field ecotone where most nests are 30m outside forest edge and rarely to 20m inside forests (Gill et al. 2001).  ****Hand Modeling: Do not restrict disturbed successional or shrub/scrub MU's to ecotone buffer. Amy Silvano 6jun05

references: Harrison, H.H. 1984. Wood warblers' world. Simon and Schuster, New York. 335 pp.
Hamel, P. B. 1992. The land manager's guide to the birds of the south. The Nature Conservancy, Chapel Hill, North Carolina. 367 pp + several appendices.
American Ornithologists' Union (AOU). 1983. Check-list of North American Birds, 6th edition. Allen Press, Inc., Lawrence, Kansas. 877 pp.
Curson, J., D. Quinn and D. Beadle. 1994. Warblers of the americas: an identification guide. Houghton Mifflin Co., New York. 252 p.
Stiles, F.G., and A.F. Skutch. 1989. A guide to the birds of Costa Rica. Comstock Publ. Associates, Cornell University Press, Ithaca, New York. 511 pp.
Palmer-Ball, B.L., Jr. 1996. The Kentucky Breeding Bird Atlas. The University Press of Kentucky, Lexington.
Anderson, S. H. 1981. Correlating habitat variables and birds. Studies in Avian Biology. 6:538-542.
Harrison, H.H. 1975. A field guide to bird's nests in the U.S. east of the Mississippi River. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston, Massachusetts. 257 p.
Dunn, J.L., and K.L. Garrett. 1997. A field guide to warblers of North America. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston.
Griscom, L., and A. Sprunt, Jr. 1979. The warblers of America. Doubleday and Co., Garden City, New York. 302 pp.
Harrison, H.H. 1979. A field guide to western birds' nests. Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston. 279 pp.
Simpson M.B Jr. 1992. Birds of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Chapel Hill and London: University of North Carolina Press.

Gill, F.B., R.A. Canterbury, and J.L. Confer. 2001. Blue-winged warbler (Vermovora pinus). In The Birds of North America, No. 607 (A. Poole and F. Gill, eds.). The Birds of North America, Inc., Philadelphia, PA.
Bent, A.C. 1953. Life histories of North American wood warblers. U.S. Natl. Mus. Bull. 203. Washington, D.C.
Terres, J.K. 1980. The Audubon Society encyclopedia of North American birds. Alfred A. Knopf, New York.
Harrison, C. 1978. A field guide to the nests, eggs and nestlings of North American birds. Collins, Cleveland, Ohio.
Potter, E. F., J. F. Parnell, and R. P. Teulings. 1980. Birds of the Carolinas. Univ. North Carolina Press, Chapel Hill. 408 pp.
